NOTICE OF EX PARTE COMMUNICATION As an interested party in the net metering proceeding at the California Public Utilities Commission, R.20-08-020, CADEM Assembly Delegate (AD10) Lee Miller gives notice of the attached ex parte communication on behalf of herself and the other organizations listed on the communication. Today, on October 4, 2023, CADEM Assembly Delegate (AD10) Lee Miller sent the attached resolutions from local California Democratic Party organizations to all five Commissioners, as well as Kerry Fleisher in the Office of President Alice Reynolds, Cheryl Wynn and Jack Chang in the Office of Commissioner Genevieve Shiroma, Karin Sung, Maryam Mozafari, and Adam Buchholz in the Office of Commissioner Darcie Houck, Suzanne Casazza and Maria Sotero in the Office of Commissioner John Reynolds, and Kourtney Vaccaro and Simi Rose George in the Office of Commissioner Karen Douglas. The resolutions were also sent to staff of Governor Gavin Newsom. The resolutions express opposition to the proposed decision that would effectively deny renters living in multifamily homes, schools and farms the ability to directly lower their utility bills through rooftop solar and battery storage. The resolutions call for the CPUC to allow on-site netting for all utility customers with multiple meters, with no exceptions.

The Joint IOUs communication was initiated by Amy Barr, Regulatory Relations Principal, of PG&E, and took place on Wednesday, September 6, 2023, at approximately 12:00 PM, via WebEx, with President Alice Reynolds Chief Policy Advisor, Kerry Fleisher, and Legal & Policy Advisor, Simi Rose George.  Others participating in the meeting were:  PG&E - Colin Kerrigan, Rate Analyst Principal.  SCE - Marissa Blunschi, Principal Manager of State Regulatory Relations; and Rob Thomas, Director of Pricing, Design and Research. SDG&E - Dennis Peters, Manager Regulatory Relations; and Gwen Morien, Rate Strategy and Design Manager

NOTTICE OF EX PARTE COMMUNICATION Pursuant to Rule 8.4 of the Rules of Practice and Procedure of the California Public Utilities Commission (CPUC), as an interested party in the net metering proceeding at the CPUC, R.20-08-020, Prologis gives notice of an ex parte communication. On September 5, 2023, the following individuals met via video conference with Kerry Fleisher, Chief Policy Advisor, and Simi George, Energy Advisor, to CPUC President Alice Busching Reynolds.  -Scott Peattie, Prologis, VP, Commercial and Industrial Energy Solutions-Alexis Moch, Prologis, Director, Government Affairs -Faith Conley, Weidman Group At the meeting, participants discussed the following points: The proposed VNEM and NEMA tariffs do not come close to enabling cost-effective projects, including with energy storage. Both tariffs are important. Standalone multi-tenant buildings are a good fit for VNEM, whereas clusters of buildings are a better fit for NEMA. These tariffs are important for enabling solar on commercial warehouses in urban areas, where local distribution is lacking. The meeting was requested by Mr. Peattie. It started at 1:30 pm and lasted 30 minutes. No materials were presented.

NOTICE OF EX PARTE COMMUNICATION As an interested party in the net metering proceeding at the California Public Utilities Commission, R.20-08-020, KIRE Building Inc. gives notice of the attached ex parte communication on behalf of itself and seventeen other multifamily housing providers and community leaders. Today, on June 26, 2023, KIRE Building Inc sent the attached letter to all five Commissioners, as well as Maria Sotero and Kerry Fleischer, advisors to Commissioner Guzman Aceves, Brian Korpics, advisor to President Marybel Batjer, Simi George, advisor to Commissioner Rechtschaffen, Cheryl Wynn, advisor to Commissioner Shiroma, and Mary Claire Brown, advisor to Commissioner Houck. In addition, the letter was sent to Governor Newsoms energy staff. The communication was sent on behalf of the organizations listed on the letter. It expresses the need for maintaining a strong incentive and value proposition for multifamily properties to continue installing solar and storage and other distributed energy resources (DER) under the Virtual Net Metering (VNEM) program.

NOTICE OF EX PARTE COMMUNICATION Pursuant to Rule 8.4 of the Rules of Practice and Procedure of the California Public Utilities Commission (Commission), the California Solar & Storage Association (CALSSA) hereby gives notice of an ex parte communication relevant to Commission Rulemaking 20-08-020. On June 7, 2023, Kerry Fleisher of the Office of President Alice Reynolds met via Webex with Brad Heavner, Policy Director of CALSSA. The meeting began at 1:00 pm and lasted approximately 30 minutes. The meeting was requested by Mr. Heavner. At the meeting, Mr. Heavner discussed party comments related to virtual net energy metering and net metering aggregation and advocated for a distinction between on-site usage and property-level exports as a key attribute of new tariffs for all multimeter properties.

SAN DIEGO GAS & ELECTRIC COMPANY’S (U 902-E) NOTICE OF COMMUNICATION AT CONFERENCE Pursuant to Rule 8.3(c) and Rule 8.4(a) of the California Public Utilities Commission’s Rules of Practice and Procedure, San Diego Gas & Electric Company (“SDG&E”) (U 902-E) notice of the following Communication at the California Foundation on the Environment and the Economy (“CFEE”) Energy Summit Conference related to the above proceedings on Friday, February 10, 2023 in Session 4 for approximately twenty minutes within the 9:00 a.m. - 10:20 a.m. time frame at CFEE Energy Summit held at Carneros Resort and Spa, Napa Hall, 4048 Sonoma  Highway, Napa, California, 94559.   Initiated by California Foundation on the Environment and the Economy (CFEE) attended by Dan Skopec, Sr. Vice President, State Government Affairs & Chief Regulatory Officer, SDG&E / SoCalGas Severin Borenstein, Professor and Researcher, Energy Institute at Haas Debra Gore-Mann, President & CEO, The Greenlining Institute -Michael Mische, Professor, Management and Organization, USC Marshall School of  Business, Liane Randolph, Chair, California Air Resources Board -Michael Wara, Director of the Climate and Energy Policy Program, Stanford Woods  Institute for the Environment -Merrian Borgeson, California Policy Director, Climate and Clean Energy Program,  Natural Resources Defense Council-Jay Hansen, President & CEO, CFEE The following were listed on the agenda and may have been in the audience at the time of the presentation: -David Hochschild, Chair, California Energy Commission -Richard Corey, Partner, AJW, and Former Executive Officer, California Air Resources  Board-Elliott Mainzer, President and CEO, California Independent System Operator -California State Senate Steve Bradford, Chair, Energy, Utilities and Communications Committee; Scott Wilk, Energy, Utilities and Communications Committee-California State Assembly, Eduardo Garcia, Chair, Utilities and Energy Committee; Alice Reynolds, President -Karen Douglas, Commissioner -Leuwam Tesfai, Deputy Executive Director for Energy and Climate Policy

THE PUBLIC ADVOCATES OFFICE’S REPORT ON EX PARTE MEETING  WITH  COMMISSIONER DARCIE HOUCK’S OFFICE In accordance with Rule 8.4 of the California Public Utilities Commission’s (Commission) Rules of Practice and Procedure, the Public Advocates Office at the California Public Utilities Commission (Cal Advocates) hereby provides this notice on the ex parte meeting in Rulemaking (R.) 20-08-020 (Revisiting Net Energy Metering), with representatives from the offices of Commissioner Darcie Houck.1The meeting took place via Webex/teleconference call at 11:00 AM PST on December 8, 2022.  Karin Sung (Energy and Transportation Advisor) attended on behalf of Commissioner Houck.  Michael Campbell (Branch Manager), Shelly Lyser (Program and Project Supervisor), Cindy Li (Program and Project Supervisor), Nathan Chau (Public Utility Resource Analyst), Justin Ong (Public Utility Resource Analyst) and Wayne A. Parker (Attorney) attended on behalf of Cal Advocates.

GRID ALTERNATIVES, VOTE SOLAR, AND SIERRA CLUB EX PARTE NOTICE Pursuant to Rule 8.4of the Rules of Practice and Procedure of the California Public Utilities Commission (“Commission”), GRID Alternatives, Vote Solar, and Sierra Club (“Joint Parties”) respectfully provide this report following four separate ex parte meetings in the above-referenced proceeding, which all covered the same topics. Sierra Club requested each meeting on behalf of the Joint Parties and occurred at the following times:•Wednesday, December 7, 2022 from 3:00pm-3:30pm with Maria Sotero, Advisor to Commissioner John Reynolds, and Christopher Westerley, Energy Division via Webex; Thursday, December 8, 2022 from 11:30am-12:00pm with Simi George, Advisor to Commissioner Rechtschaffen, and Kerry Fleischer, Interim Energy Advisor to President Reynolds, via Webex;•Friday, December 9, 2022 from 11:00am-11:30am with Dr. Bridget Horan, Advisor to Commissioner Houck, via Webex; and; Friday, December 9, 2022 from 1:30pm-2:00pm with Andrew Dugowson, Energy and Transportation Advisor to Commissioner Shiroma, via conference call. Non-Commission staff in attendance at every meeting included Katherine Ramsey (representing Sierra Club), Stephen Campbell (representing GRID Alternatives), and Stephanie Doyle (representing Vote Solar), except that Mr. Campbell did not attend the Wednesday meeting. No written materials were exchanged, and communications were limited to addressing the low-income customer issues in this proceeding.

FOUNDATION WINDPOWER, LLC NOTICE OF EX PARTE COMMUNICATION Pursuant to Rule 8.4 of the Rules of Practice and Procedure of the California Public Utilities Commission (“Commission”), Foundation Windpower, LLC (“Foundation”) hereby provides notice of an ex parte communication in R-20-08-020. The meeting took place via Webex on Friday December 9, 2022, from 10:00 am to approximately 10:15 am. Kerry Fleisher, Interim Energy Policy Advisor to President Reynolds, and Winnie Chen, Policy Assistant to Commissioner Rechtschaffen, attended for the Commission. Steve Sherr, Executive Vice President, Kevin Hauck, Executive Vice President, and Matt Wilson, Chief Executive Officer, attended for Foundation.

ADMINISTRATIVE LAW JUDGE’S RULING REJECTING CALIFORNIA LOW-INCOME CONSUMER COALITION’S NOTICE OF INTENT TO CLAIM INTERVENOR COMPENSATION. The Notice of Intent to Claim Intervenor Compensation filed by California Low-Income Consumer Coalition is rejected, as set forth. The California Low-Income Consumer Coalition has not satisfied the eligibility requirements of Pub. Util. Code § 1804(a).

Parties are encouraged to collaborate with other parties to develop and file a joint proposal.
